result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Dwayne Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
*Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so).
*If confinement is served -  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
*Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school.
*Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
*No Contact Order with Santana K.,  AND/OR  Chanel S.    AND/OR  the address of 3807 West Center Street, City of Milwaukee.
*AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: *No employment release privileges, no electronic monitoring.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  42  months with 82  days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  18  months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  24  months.
COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  3 years.

Court finds defendant   IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and  IS  eligible for the Substance abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Serve 6 months in the House of Correction, no employment release privileges, no electronic monitoring
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with Santana K.,  AND/OR  Chanel S.    AND/OR  the address of 3807 West Center Street, City of Milwaukee
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with Santana K.,  AND/OR  Chanel S.    AND/OR  the address of 3807 West Center Street, City of Milwaukee
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
If confinement is served -  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Edward Dwayne Martin in court with Attorney Eric R. Hart.  Defendant Edward Dwayne Martin in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY   and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Jury trial is vacated.
Clerk:  jms

from Atty. E. Hart with cover letter dated February 8, 2016 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

BRANCH 28 HELD IN BRANCH 26.  Attorney Eric R. Hart in court, defendant Edward Dwayne Martin not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests jury trial.   Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial scheduled, Branch 28.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant's Preliminary Pretrial Motions and Motions In Limine with cover letter dated December 28, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES defense motion for bail reduction.

Defendant Edward Dwayne Martin in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Edward Dwayne Martin in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-Defendants Michael nelson and Willie Williams or Santana K

Defendant Edward Dwayne Martin in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Edward Dwayne Martin in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 3109 North Sherman Boulevard, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
